@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:519350”]c.c.getItems().getItemName(i);
Assuming you left the variable i alone.[/quote]i is just the index of the array, but not the item in the array.

as from the previous package structure in the original post, i can assume that he isn’t using a project insanity based server (as for your constructors/getters)

item.title: Trouble displaying Item Received in Mystery Box In Global message
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

dont know what the package structure of the base; but 99.9999% of all servers have a getter for the item name.

pseudo:

players.getPackets().sendGameMessage("<img=5><col=ff0000>" + player.getDisplayName() + " Has Just Received a " + players.getItems().getItemName(RandomItems[i]) + " From A Mystery Box!</col>");sorry for shit conventions

item.title: Trouble displaying Item Received in Mystery Box In Global message
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

What do you mean? and also try to do this;
player.getInventory().addItem(RandomItems[i], 1);
Replace with
player.getInventory().addItem(f, 1);
now before that line add;
int f = RandomItems[i];
then change this line;
players.getPackets().sendGameMessage("<img=5><col=ff0000>" + player.getDisplayName() + " Has Just Received a “+i+” From A Mystery Box!");
To;
players.getPackets().sendGameMessage("<img=5><col=ff0000>" + player.getDisplayName() + " Has Just Received a “+f+” From A Mystery Box!");

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble displaying Item Received in Mystery Box In Global message
item.dc:creator: @James6213 James6213
item.description:
@James6213 wrote:

Currently got this code

if (itemId == 6199) { int[] RandomItems = {1038,1040,1042,1044,1046,1048,18349,18349,18351,18353,18355,18357,18335,1053,1055,1057,1050,1050,14595,14603,10350,10348,10346,10340,10338,10342,10330,10332,10334,10352, }; //Other ids go in there as well int i = Utils.getRandom(RandomItems.length); player.getInventory().deleteItem(6199, 1); player.getInventory().addItem(RandomItems[i], 1); for (Player players : World.getPlayers()) { if (players == null) continue; players.getPackets().sendGameMessage("<img=5><col=ff0000>" + player.getDisplayName() + " Has Just Received a Random Item From A Mystery Box!</col>"); } return; }

Basically I want it to display what Item I get in the Mystery Box in the global message so atm it is like this

I want instead of ‘Random Item’ to say ‘Red Partyhat’ or whatever Item is received in the Box.

If anyone knows how I could do this please reply to this post thanks in advanced.

Read full topic
